But ABC fared better the rest of the night, as a repeat of its game show Wipeout tied CBSs Big Brother at 8 with 6.4 million viewers and as ABCs Rookie Blue (6.8 million) edged ahead of a CSI rerun (6 million) on CBS. Fox ranked third over all with a Glee repeat (3.8 million) and a results episode of So You Think You Can Dance (5.8 million). NBC placed fourth with reruns.

title: Jersey Shore Scores; Snooki Is Arrested
description: The programmers at MTV must have pumped their fists when the overnight ratings for Jersey Shore arrived on Friday. (Although they might not have been so thrilled Friday afternoon after seeing reports that one of the shows stars, Nicole Polizzi, known as Snooki, had been arrested in Seaside Heights, N.J., and accused of disorderly conduct.) The premiere of the second season of Jersey Shore attracted 5.3 million viewers on Thursday night, according to Nielsen, the networks biggest season premiere in more than seven years. The series about young people partying at the beach  its really that simple  was a sensation last winter for MTV, peaking at 4.8 million viewers for the finale. But Thursday nights ratings indicate that the show has legs, even in the summer. Among MTVs core demographic of viewers 12 to 34 years old, the season premiere is the No. 1 cable telecast of the year. The series will follow the casts exploits in South Beach, last spring in Florida; it is now filming their return to Seaside Heights this summer.

title: Predators and Prey, and Catching Turtles
description: As I said in a previous post, scientists have noted a pattern of a higher ratio of standing predator to prey biomass on the atoll, which contrasts with most other marine and terrestrial ecosystems (for example, think about the small ratios of top mammalian predators to grazers on the African savanna). They hypothesize that extremely high rates of production in the prey, including algae; corals, clams and other invertebrates; and smaller fish, supports the predators. This is coupled with high rates at which prey are eaten or otherwise die (called turnover). Another possibility is that the larger-bodied fish can live on relatively low amounts of food for many years, even decades, when protected from fishing.

title: Sudan: Violent Clashes Erupt Over Peace Talks for Darfur
description: Violent clashes among displaced Sudanese erupted in Kalma camp in the southern Darfur region this week, leaving about 10 people dead, Alain Le Roy, the head of United Nations peacekeeping operations, told the Security Council on Friday. The fighting pitted supporters of peace talks between rebel groups and the Sudanese government, taking place in Doha, Qatar, against opponents of reconciliation. Surging tension has plagued the region in western Sudan this year as fighting has resumed between the government and the rebels, and as fractious tribes battle among themselves, according to United Nations reports. Around 600 people, largely combatants, have died in the past few months, the reports said, with 400 killed in May, making it the deadliest month in Darfur since peacekeeping troops first deployed there in December 2007.

The other demonstrations are taking place Saturday, the first anniversary of the hikers imprisonment. Iran has accused the three  Shane M. Bauer, Sarah E. Shourd and Joshua F. Fattal  of spying but has not produced evidence or put them on trial. The three were on a trip from Syria to hike in northern Iraq when they either strayed or were forced across the border into Iran. description: Q. The bleak job market has you considering working in a family members business. What are the biggest differences between working for relatives and working for strangers?

title: India Digs Under Top of the World to Match Rival
description: ROHTANG PASS, India  The name of this white-knuckle pass, one of the highest in the world, means pile of corpses in the Tibetan language. Every year a few dozen people die trying to cross these spiky Himalayan peaks.

title: Turbines Too Loud? Here, Take $5,000
description: IONE, Ore.  Residents of the remote high-desert hills near here have had an unusual visitor recently, a fixer working out the kinks in clean energy.

title: $200 Textbook vs. Free. You Do the Math.
description: INFURIATING Scott G. McNealy has never been easier. Just bring up math textbooks.

title: Wales Takes a Turn in the Spotlight
description: To the uninitiated, Wales has always seemed like the British version of flyover country. You may have heard the put-downs: its merely a hard-to-reach place on the southwest coast of the sceptered isle that is lacking in vowels, five-star hotels and links land. What could possibly interest the jaded golf traveler whose trek through Ireland, England and the hallowed grounds of Scotland detours around Wales every time.

title: Gap in N.L. East Starts With Bullpen
description: By trading for Roy Oswalt on Thursday, the Philadelphia Phillies undoubtedly strengthened their starting rotation. But the bullpen remains the biggest difference between the Phillies and the first-place Atlanta Braves in the National League East.

title: The Mexican Borders Lost World
description: TIJUANA, Mexico  Never a particularly pretty place, the border is at its ugliest right now, with violence, tensions and temperatures all on high.

title: Outsourced, but Still Local
description: WHEN I was 14, I got a job in a local dental office. I worked there after school and during the summer through high school. It was a defining experience. Walking in the door of that office, I had to switch from high school student to empathetic professional.

title: Running Government as a Cash Business
description: The lawyer for Rod R. Blagojevich urged jurors last week to acquit his client of corruption charges, in part because Mr. Blagojevich, the chatty former governor of Illinois, was simply too dull to carry out the devious schemes of which he stands accused.

title: Missouri to Vote on Health Law
description: ST. CHARLES, Mo.  For all its symbolic import, the first plebiscite on the Obama health care law, to be held Tuesday in Missouri, seems likely to be a low-turnout affair among an electorate dominated by Republican primary voters and conservative activists.

title: With Friends Like This ...
description: IS it a blinding statement of the obvious to say that trust in the worlds banks has suffered lately? Indeed, just when you think youre ready to move past the steady drumbeat of disconcerting revelations, something else crops up to test your faith.

title: Small Step on Small Fees, but Big Charges Remain
description: PICTURE a tiny hole in the hull of a ship on a long ocean voyage. It is slowly letting in water. If the hole isnt plugged, the leak will eventually slow the vessel drastically  maybe even sink it.

title: Rethinking the Afghanistan Wars What-Ifs
description: WASHINGTON  Long before Afghanistan became the longest shooting war in American history, the question loomed: Could it have turned out differently?

title: For No Signs of Trouble, Kill the Alarm
description: When an oil worker told investigators on July 23 that an alarm to warn of explosive gas on the Transocean rig in the Gulf of Mexico had been intentionally disabled months before, it struck many people as reckless.

title: The Academic-Industrial Complex
description: WHAT does Shirley Ann Jackson know about shipping parcels? For that matter, what does Steven B. Sample understand about mutual funds?

title: After Stroke Scans, Patients Face Serious Health Risks
description: When Alain Reyess hair suddenly fell out in a freakish band circling his head, he was not the only one worried about his health. His co-workers at a shipping company avoided him, and his boss sent him home, fearing he had a contagious disease.

title: Many Indigent Refugees to Lose Federal Assistance
description: WASHINGTON  The Social Security Administration is about to terminate cash assistance for thousands of indigent refugees who are severely disabled or over the age of 64.

title: Is It Hot in Here? Must Be Global Warming.
description: In any debate over climate change, conventional wisdom holds that there is no reflex more absurd than invoking the local weather.

title: In Information War, Documentary Is Latest Salvo
description: MOSCOW  A new documentary film about the Belarussian president, Aleksandr G. Lukashenko, portrays him as a bumbling tyrant enamored of Hitler and Stalin. He has political opponents killed, journalists silenced and elections rigged in the film, all while keeping his faltering country locked in a Soviet time warp.

title: A Richter Scale for Markets
description: Its tempting to pull out the old earthquake metaphor when talking about the latest financial crises. How else to describe the economic devastation  the tremors in the subprime mortgage market, the seismic collapse of Lehman Brothers, and the aftershocks reverberating in Europe?

title: A Trip to Tibet, With My Handlers Nearby
description: LHASA, Tibet  One warm morning on the campus of Tibet University, a couple of foreign journalists on a government-run tour of Tibet quietly broke away from the group to talk to students standing on a grassy lawn. Security guards dashed in and waved the students away.

title: Is Italy Too Italian?
description: THIS tradition is finita, says Luciano Barbera, as he opens the door to an underground warehouse. Dozens of large wooden boxes are stacked to the ceiling, containing nearly 80 tons of colorful thread, wound in spools and idling like sunbathers at a beach, absorbing moisture in a cavernous room kept naturally cool and humid by a creek that burbles under the floor.

title: In Italy, Choosing Tradition Over Growth
description: An Italian fine textile companys debt woes, like those of the country, can be traced to a mistrust of those not in the family, and an aversion to risk and growth.

title: Koneru Takes the Lead in Mongolia
A Call to Fix the Fundamentals
description: IN 2005, Raghuram G. Rajan told a meeting of the worlds top central bankers, Alan Greenspan included, that the global financial system was threatened from within and might well be facing a full-blown crisis. At the time, he says, he was roundly criticized. But given what happened a few years later we may not want to dismiss his recent assertion that the global economy is vulnerable to another implosion.

title: Indias Himalayan Tunnel
description: India is building a tunnel to bypass the dangerous Rohtang Pass as part of a plan to match China for regional and global power.

title: The Amanpour Era Begins
description: Ill be with the new host of This Week this week  tomorrow.

title: What Theyre Not Telling You
description: There is a lot of heated talk in Washington these days about the deficit, unfortunately little of it serious. Playing on Americans deep anxiety about the economy, Republican politicians have seized the deficit issue as their own  eagerly blaming the stimulus and even an extension of unemployment insurance for the problem  while denying their own culpability for helping dig this deep hole with years of irresponsible tax cuts.

title: Queens Man Fatally Stabbed at Subway Station
description: A 27-year-old Queens man was fatally stabbed at an elevated subway station late Friday after his mother said he ran to help his younger brother, who was being beaten near a video store in the Woodhaven neighborhood.

title: Death of a Farm
description: Farms go out of business for many reasons, but few farms do merely because the soil has failed. That is the miracle of farming. If you care for the soil, it will last  and yield  nearly forever. America is such a young country that we have barely tested that. For most of our history, there has been new land to farm, and we still farm as though there always will be.

title: Health Care Memories
description: Do you remember how public hatred of the health care reform was going to be the dominant issue in the midterm elections? Do you remember how there was going to be a firestorm of disapproval over the Democrats use of reconciliation to pass the legislation despite the fact that they only had 59 out of 100 Senators?

title: The Mark of an Overdose
description: Voices of patients who received radiation overdoses from a procedure called a CT brain perfusion scan.

title: Correction
description: An article last Sunday about the growth of the online game company Zynga misstated its predicted revenue. According to the Inside Network, which tracks Facebook apps, Zynga is expected to take in as much as $500 million this year, not $835 million.

description: WASHINGTON  When Representative Maxine Waters, Democrat of California, called Treasury Secretary Henry M. Paulson Jr. in late 2008 to ask him to host a special meeting that would feature a California bank executive she knew well, was the request on behalf of a trade association, or a bank in which her husband owned stock?

description: To the Editor:

title: Economic Indicator: Even Cheaper Knockoffs
description: In this economy, even counterfeiters are trading down.

title: Mad Men and Bad Girls
description: WASHINGTON

title: The Trading Deadline: Who Went Where
description: Some notable names were moved before todays 4 p.m. Eastern trading deadline, but Adam Dunn was not one of them. The Yankees were busy, adding Lance Berkman and Kerry Wood, while the Dodgers bolstered their rotation by adding Ted Lilly. Continue reading to see how the rest of it unfolded.

title: Alex Higgins, the Bombastic Peoples Champion of Pro Snooker, Dies at 61
description: The rogues of sport are legion. Gifted, charismatic and reckless, they burn with hubris, flout convention, seize championships and rouse fans. Bobby Fischer at the chessboard. Mike Tyson in the ring. On the links, the young John Daly and the not-so-young Tiger Woods. Alex Higgins  smoker, drinker, brawler, gambler, womanizer and two-time world snooker champion  was an exemplar of the type.

title: Kiss This War Goodbye
description: IT was on a Sunday morning, June 13, 1971, that The Times published its first installment of the Pentagon Papers. Few readers may have been more excited than a circle of aspiring undergraduate journalists whod worked at The Harvard Crimson. Though the identity of The Timess source wouldnt eke out for several days, we knew the whistle-blower had to be Daniel Ellsberg, an intense research fellow at M.I.T. and former Robert McNamara acolyte whod become an antiwar activist around Boston. We recognized the papers contents, as reported in The Times, because wed heard the war stories from the loquacious Ellsberg himself.

title: A French Castle Built of Stone and Dreams
description: TREIGNY, France  Maryline Martin, like a lot of little French girls, was besotted with the Middle Ages, with castles and maidens and knights. She worked for Pier 1 Imports for a while, then came back to this part of Burgundy and thought she would grow mushrooms. She worked instead in an agency trying to find work for the jobless, but the fakery and cynicism involved outraged her, she said.

title: Pros vs. Joes: Q. and A. With Michael Strahan
description: N.F.L. training camps are opening, and Michael Strahan says he is happy that he will be in a comfortable television studio. Those wilting two-a-day workouts are one of the few football rituals that Strahan, a former All-Pro defensive end for the Giants, says he does not miss since he retired in 2008. A key member of the team that won Super Bowl XLII, Strahan gets his sports fix now as a co-host of Pros vs. Joes on Spike TV. The reality show pits amateurs against professionals in various sports. He is also an analyst for Fox NFL Sunday.

title: The Great (Double) Game
description: The trove of WikiLeaks about the faltering U.S. war effort in Afghanistan has provoked many reactions, but for me it contains one clear message. Its actually an old piece of advice your parents may have given you before you went off to college: If you are in a poker game and you dont know who the sucker is, its probably you.

title: Despite Rule, BP Used Dispersant, Panel Finds
description: The Coast Guard approved dozens of requests by BP to spread hundreds of thousands of gallons of surface oil dispersants in the Gulf of Mexico despite the Environmental Protection Agencys directive on May 26 that they should be used only rarely, according to documents and correspondence analyzed by a Congressional subcommittee.

title: Play Bargaining
description: SUNDAYS PUZZLE  Did the title tip you off as to the theme? It didnt for me, but it wasnt too long before the trick revealed itself  a long A sound replaces a long E sound at the end of one word in 10 common phrases.

title: Another Pill That Could Cause a Revolution
description: Could the decades-long global impasse over abortion worldwide be overcome  by little white pills costing less than $1 each?

title: Four Deformations of the Apocalypse
description: IF there were such a thing as Chapter 11 for politicians, the Republican push to extend the unaffordable Bush tax cuts would amount to a bankruptcy filing. The nations public debt  if honestly reckoned to include municipal bonds and the $7 trillion of new deficits baked into the cake through 2015  will soon reach $18 trillion. Thats a Greece-scale 120 percent of gross domestic product, and fairly screams out for austerity and sacrifice. It is therefore unseemly for the Senate minority leader, Mitch McConnell, to insist that the nations wealthiest taxpayers be spared even a three-percentage-point rate increase.

title: Mistaken as an Iranian Martyr, Then Hounded
description: FRANKFURT  Zahra Soltani, whom everyone calls Neda, will never forget the day she saw her death announced on television, accompanied by the picture she had posted on her Facebook page. They said that I was killed during the protests against the presidential elections, she said, shaking her head.

title: Eight Million Bodies in the Naked City
description: YOU could argue that when one assumes a chicken fight position at a crowded field of drunken and sweaty hipsters on Governors Island for a concert featuring M.I.A. and other musicians, its only fitting to do so topless. Chickens are generally a clothing-free bunch, so wearing nothing but a fedora above the waist is really the purest tribute to the pose.

title: Learning From WikiLeaks
description: Saco, Me.

title: For One Senate Seat in Illinois, Two Elections on the Same Day
description: CHICAGO  In all the fuss over the Senate seat that President Obama left behind here, and whether it was offered up in a nefarious trade, some people demanded a clean start. Let the voters of Illinois elect someone to fill the vacancy.

title: In Pakistan, Echoes of American Betrayal
description: Karachi, Pakistan

title: For Champion Olympic Swimmer, a Simpler Time
description: TUCSON  It was a curly blue ribbon, much thinner than the ones Amanda Beard collected as a child for winning swim races. Holding none of her seven Olympic medals, it held no value except in the eyes of her playful 10-month-old son.

title: American Muslims Make Video to Rebut Militants
description: A recent spate of arrests of Muslims accused of terrorism in the United States has revealed that many of them were radicalized by militant preaching they found on the Internet.

title: Immigration Policy Aims to Help Military Families
description: The Obama administration, responding to requests from Democratic and Republican lawmakers, has taken steps to make it easier for illegal immigrants who are spouses and family members of Americans serving in the military to gain legal status.

title: Hottest July Ever? Not Quite
description: After weeks of brutal temperatures that flirted with the record books, July ended with a beautiful day in New York, offering the city much-needed relief, but foiling the chance to make history.

title: The Latest Challenge for Woods Takes Him to One of His Favorite Places
description: The World Golf Championships are back and so is Tiger Woods, who takes his 2010 golf redemption tour to the friendly confines of Akron, Ohio, to defend his W.G.C.-Bridgestone Invitational title this week at the South Course of Firestone Country Club  a course he has all but owned for more than a decade.

description: Gary Skinner did not expect much when the shrimping season opened more than a month late in Alabamas Mobile Bay.
